frqParts.text: In the introduction to his 2014 book about culture in the United States, critic Jeff Chang, who has written on popular culture, politics, music, and the arts, argued: “Every moment of major social change requires a collective leap of imagination. Change presents itself not only in spontaneous and organized expressions of unrest and risk, but in explosions of mass creativity.” Write an essay that argues your position on the extent to which Chang’s claim about social change is valid. In your response you should do the following: Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents a defensible position. Provide evidence to support your line of reasoning. Explain how the evidence supports your line of reasoning. Use appropriate grammar and punctuation in communicating your argument.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Write introductions and conclusions appropriate to the purpose and context of the rhetorical situation.
